alert.note: Alert for Pike (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Binghamton (South Central New York and Northeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 08 at 6:26PM EDT by NWS Binghamton
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT CENTRAL PIKE COUNTY THROUGH 700 PM EDT... At 625 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Greeley to Mountainhome. Movement was east at 10 mph. Strong to severe thunderstorms were also located near the Delaware River between Matamoras and Bushkill HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Shohola, Greeley, Pecks Pond, Twin Lakes, Tamiment, and Lords Valley. This includes the following highway exits... Interstate 84 near 34. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM EDT for central New York...and northeastern Pennsylvania.
